General.Name: PULSION Medical Systems SE
General.Description: PULSION Medical Systems SE engages in the development, manufacture, sale of monitoring, diagnosis, and therapy control systems for recording physiological parameters of hospitalized, seriously ill, and intensive care patients. Its technologies include PiCCO2Â, a system used in intensive care medicine for the treatment of critically ill patients; PulsioFlexÂ that offers technology in the field of perioperative medicine; PiCCOÂ, a catheter used to monitor the cardiovascular system; ProAQTÂ, a sensor used in medicine for high-risk patients and high-risk interventions; CeVOXÂ, a technology that enables continuous monitoring of the patient's oxygen balance; LiMONÂ, a technology used to assess and monitor liver function; NICCI for hemodynamic monitoring. The company was founded in 1990 and is based in Feldkirchen, Germany. PULSION Medical Systems SE was a former subsidiary of MAQUET GmbH
